file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 30-42-03-04 - WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S. B. 145-30-0033 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the windshield power contactors. B. These procedures are applicable to windshield power contactor 1 and windshield power contactor 2. C. Windshield power contactor 1 is installed in a box at the support between frames 10 and 12, below the cockpit floor, on the LH side. Windshield power contactor 2 is installed in a box at the support between frames 10 and 12, below the cockpit floor, on the RH side. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PRE-MOD. S. B. WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR - RE- 30-42-03-000-801-A 145-30-0033 MOVAL PRE-MOD. S. B. WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR - IN- 30-42-03-400-801-A 145-30-0033 STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 30-42-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-42-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S. B. 145-30-0033 2. WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the windshield power contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A/400 COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 221 221CF Cockpit LH/Floor panel 222 222BF Cockpit RH/Floor panel D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Area below the cockpit floor, on the LH 1 Does the task and/or RH side I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the GPU pushbutton, on the Overhead Panel, is set to OFF. (2) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag, on the GPU pushbutton. (3) Make sure that the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches, on the Overhead Panel, are set to OFF. (4) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag, on the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-42-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Set the BACKUP pushbutton, on the Overhead Panel, to OFF. (6) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag on the BACKUP pushbutton. (7) Remove the pilot and/or copilot seat (AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400). (8) To get access to windshield power contactor 1, remove floor panel 221CF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100) and ( AMM TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A/400). (9) To get access to windshield power contactor 2, remove floor panel 222BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100) and ( AMM TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the four screws (9) and washers (8) that attach the box cover (7). (2) Remove the two nuts (4) and washers (3) that attach the two wires (6) and the wire (5). (3) Remove the four screws (10) and washers (11) that attach the windshield power contactor box (1). (4) Remove the windshield power contactor box (1) with the windshield power contactor (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-42-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-30-0033 Windshield Power Contactor - Removal/Installation Figure 401 1. WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR BOX A 11. WASHER (4) 10. SCREW (4) 9. SCREW (4) 8.WASHER (4) B DET. A 7. BOX COVER 2. WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR 3. WASHER (2) 4. NUT (2) 1 DET. B 1 5. WIRE 6. WIRE (2) 1 TORQUE: 2.6 TO 2.9 N.M (23.3 TO 26.0 Lb.IN) 145AMM300102C.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-42-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-42-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S. B. 145-30-0033 3. WINDSHIELD POWER CONTACTOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the windshield power contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 30-42-00-700-801-A/500 WINDSHIELD HEATING - OPERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 53-01-01-400-801-A/400 COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 221 221CF Cockpit LH/Floor panel 222 222BF Cockpit RH/Floor panel D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Area below the cockpit floor, on the LH 1 Does the task and/or RH side I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the windshield power contactor box (1) with the windshield power contactor (2). (2) Install the four washers (11) and screws (10) that attach the windshield power contactor box (1). (3) Install the two washers (3) and nuts (4) that attach the two wires (6) and the wire (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 30-42-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Install the four washers (8) and screws (9) that attach the box cover (7). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Close floor panels 221CF and 222BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100) and ( AMM TASK 53-01-01-400-801-A/400). (3) Install the pilot and/or copilot seat (AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400). (4) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the BACKUP pushbutton. (5) Set the BACKUP pushbutton to AUTO. (6) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the GPU pushbutton. (7) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (8) Do the operational check of the windshield heating system ( AMM TASK 30-42-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 30-42-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
